edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject

Class InGameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.InGameObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bullet, Goggle, Invincibility, Radar, Room

    public abstract class InGameObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This abstract class represents the objects in the game that are on the Grid. Items which will be on the board will inherit this class. All in-game objects will have a position for both row and column and a boolean which states whether the item is still in-play or not. Additionally, this class implements Serializable.
    Author:
    Richard Pham, Oakar Kyaw, Ethan Liao, Jeremy Anunwah, Bennett Wong.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      This field represents whether or not the object is still on the board or not.
      private int positionColumn
      This field represents the column of the position the object is in.
      private int positionRow
      This field represents the row of the position the object is in.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InGameObject(int row, int columm)
      This constructor will set the row and column position of the in-game object according to what is passed into the parameter.

    • Field Detail

      • positionRow

        private int positionRow
        This field represents the row of the position the object is in.

      • positionColumn

        private int positionColumn
        This field represents the column of the position the object is in.

      • onBoard

        private boolean onBoard
        This field represents whether or not the object is still on the board or not. If true, then the item is still on the board. If false, then the item has been used or is off the board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InGameObject

        public InGameObject(int row,
                    int columm)
        This constructor will set the row and column position of the in-game object according to what is passed into the parameter. Additionally, the onBoard boolean is set to true since in-game object is created.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the position of the object
        column - the column of the position of the object

    • Method Detail

      • getPositionRow

        public int getPositionRow()
        This method returns the row of the position of the in-game object.
        Returns:
        the row of the position of the in-game object.

      • getPositionColumn

        public int getPositionColumn()
        This method returns the column of the position of the in-game object.
        Returns:
        the column of the position of the in-game object.

      • setPositionRow

        public void setPositionRow(int row)
        This method sets the row position of the in-game object to whatever is passed into the parameter.
        Parameters:
        row - the new row of the position of the object

      • setPositionColumn

        public void setPositionColumn(int column)
        This method sets the column position of the in-game object to whatever is passed into the parameter.
        Parameters:
        column - the new column of the position of the object

      • isOnBoard

        public boolean isOnBoard()
        This method returns whether or not the in-game object is on the board or not. If true, then the object is on the board. If false, then the object is not on the board.
        Returns:
        whether or not the object is on the board.

      • use

        public void use()
        This method is called when the player moves in the position of the in-game object, such as a power-up. This method will then turn the onBoard boolean to false and set the positions of the object to positions that are off the grid (-1,-1).
